conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid from A encounters a red baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from A continues to flow down and reaches the bottom.
Liquid from A flows into the container on the left, which is container E.
Liquid from B encounters a green baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid from B continues to flow down and reaches the bottom.
Liquid from B flows into the container on the left, which is container E.
Liquid from C encounters a green baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from C continues to flow down and reaches the bottom.
Liquid from C flows into the container on the right, which is container D.
Liquid from A and B flows into container E, and liquid from C flows into container D.
The liquid will flow into both containers D and E, with A and B flowing into E, and C flowing into D.
